subject: RE: [junit] Parameterisation of tests in JUnit4
msgSnippet: ... Why is that? Say I was testing a method which validates strings, why should I add a level of redirection to the test? What s the benefit? Jon Clearswift
messageBody:
> >The only problem with this approach is that you are very limited in
> >the objects you can pass via annotations (only primitive types, and
> >this approach won't work for methods that accept more than
> one parameter).

> More importantly, it is a bad idea to use annotations to
> pass the data! Anotations should give the hints (tags,
> markers) how to get the data but not the data itself.

Why is that? Say I was testing a method which validates strings, why
should I add a level of redirection to the test? What's the benefit?

Jon
